metadata.title: CVE-2011-3891 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Google Chrome before 15.0.874.102 does not properly restrict access tointernal Google V8 functions, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via unknownvectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3891` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
